channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: SimAM: A Simple, Parameter-Free Attention Module for Convolutional Neural Networks
item.description: Another advantage of the module is that most of the operators are selected based on the solution to the defined energy function, avoiding too many efforts for structure tuning.

item.title: Automated Dilated Spatio-Temporal Synchronous Graph Modeling for Traffic Prediction
item.description: To overcome these limitations, we propose an automated dilated spatio-temporal synchronous graph network, named Auto-DSTSGN for traffic prediction.

item.title: Transformer with Implicit Edges for Particle-based Physics Simulation
item.description: Consequently, in this paper we propose a novel Transformer-based method, dubbed as Transformer with Implicit Edges (TIE), to capture the rich semantics of particle interactions in an edge-free manner.

item.title: Layer-refined Graph Convolutional Networks for Recommendation
item.description: Specifically, these models usually aggregate all layer embeddings for node updating and achieve their best recommendation performance within a few layers because of over-smoothing.

item.title: Verifying Fairness in Quantum Machine Learning
item.description: In this work, we define a formal framework for the fairness verification and analysis of quantum machine learning decision models, where we adopt one of the most popular notions of fairness in the literature based on the intuition -- any two similar individuals must be treated similarly and are thus unbiased.

item.title: Fact sheet: Automatic Self-Reported Personality Recognition Track
item.description: We propose an informed baseline to help disentangle the various contextual factors of influence in this type of case studies.

item.title: What's in the laundromat? Mapping and characterising offshore owned domestic property in London
item.description: We perform an in-depth analysis of the offshore domestic property in London, comparing the price, distribution and entropy/concentration with Airbnb property, low-use/empty property and conventional domestic property.

item.title: Faster VoxelPose: Real-time 3D Human Pose Estimation by Orthographic Projection
item.description: While the voxel-based methods have achieved promising results for multi-person 3D pose estimation from multi-cameras, they suffer from heavy computation burdens, especially for large scenes.

item.title: Multilabel Prototype Generation for Data Reduction in k-Nearest Neighbour classification
item.description: Prototype Generation (PG) methods are typically considered for improving the efficiency of the $k$-Nearest Neighbour ($k$NN) classifier when tackling high-size corpora.

item.title: On Controller Tuning with Time-Varying Bayesian Optimization
item.description: Current TVBO methods do not explicitly account for these properties, resulting in poor tuning performance and many unstable controllers through over-exploration of the parameter space.

item.title: Optimizing Image Compression via Joint Learning with Denoising
item.description: The key is to transform the original noisy images to noise-free bits by eliminating the undesired noise during compression, where the bits are later decompressed as clean images.

item.title: Decoupled Adversarial Contrastive Learning for Self-supervised Adversarial Robustness
item.description: Adversarial training (AT) for robust representation learning and self-supervised learning (SSL) for unsupervised representation learning are two active research fields.

item.title: Optimization of Forcemyography Sensor Placement for Arm Movement Recognition
item.description: To study the effectiveness of our optimization algorithm, a dataset for mechanical maintenance tasks using FMG armbands with 16 sensors is collected.

item.title: Spatio-Temporal Deformable Attention Network for Video Deblurring
item.description: The key success factor of the video deblurring methods is to compensate for the blurry pixels of the mid-frame with the sharp pixels of the adjacent video frames.

item.title: Adaptive Soft Contrastive Learning
item.description: Self-supervised learning has recently achieved great success in representation learning without human annotations.

item.title: MobileDenseNet: A new approach to object detection on mobile devices
item.description: We also developed a light neck FCPNLite for mobile devices that will aid with the detection of small objects.

item.title: Physiology-based simulation of the retinal vasculature enables annotation-free segmentation of OCT angiographs
item.description: Encouraged by our method's competitive quantitative and superior qualitative performance, we believe that it constitutes a versatile tool to advance the quantitative analysis of OCTA images.

item.title: Panoptic Scene Graph Generation
item.description: Existing research addresses scene graph generation (SGG) -- a critical technology for scene understanding in images -- from a detection perspective, i. e., objects are detected using bounding boxes followed by prediction of their pairwise relationships.

item.title: Efficient Testing of Deep Neural Networks via Decision Boundary Analysis
item.description: In practice, the de facto standard to assess the quality of DNNs in industry is to check their performance (accuracy) on a collected set of labeled test data.

item.title: Multi-Faceted Distillation of Base-Novel Commonality for Few-shot Object Detection
item.description: Most of existing methods for few-shot object detection follow the fine-tuning paradigm, which potentially assumes that the class-agnostic generalizable knowledge can be learned and transferred implicitly from base classes with abundant samples to novel classes with limited samples via such a two-stage training strategy.

item.title: Multiface: A Dataset for Neural Face Rendering
item.description: Along with the release of the dataset, we conduct ablation studies on the influence of different model architectures toward the model's interpolation capacity of novel viewpoint and expressions.

item.title: Prototype-Guided Continual Adaptation for Class-Incremental Unsupervised Domain Adaptation
item.description: 2) Prototype-based alignment and replay: based on the identified label prototypes, we align both domains and enforce the model to retain previous knowledge.

item.title: RealFlow: EM-based Realistic Optical Flow Dataset Generation from Videos
item.description: Specifically, we first estimate optical flow between a pair of video frames, and then synthesize a new image from this pair based on the predicted flow.

item.title: Long-tailed Instance Segmentation using Gumbel Optimized Loss
item.description: Major advancements have been made in the field of object detection and segmentation recently.

item.title: Respecting Time Series Properties Makes Deep Time Series Forecasting Perfect
item.description: Thanks to the core idea of respecting time series properties, no matter in which forecasting format, RTNet shows obviously superior forecasting performances compared with dozens of other SOTA time series forecasting baselines in three real-world benchmark datasets.

item.title: Scale dependant layer for self-supervised nuclei encoding
item.description: Recent developments in self-supervised learning give us the possibility to further reduce human intervention in multi-step pipelines where the focus evolves around particular objects of interest.

item.title: DeVIS: Making Deformable Transformers Work for Video Instance Segmentation
item.description: To reason about all VIS subtasks jointly over multiple frames, we present temporal multi-scale deformable attention with instance-aware object queries.

item.title: POP: Mining POtential Performance of new fashion products via webly cross-modal query expansion
item.description: We propose a data-centric pipeline able to generate exogenous observation data for the New Fashion Product Performance Forecasting (NFPPF) problem, i. e., predicting the performance of a brand-new clothing probe with no available past observations.

item.title: Custom Structure Preservation in Face Aging
item.description: In this work, we propose a novel architecture for face age editing that can produce structural modifications while maintaining relevant details present in the original image.

item.title: Rethinking the Reference-based Distinctive Image Captioning
item.description: Unfortunately, reference images used by existing Ref-DIC works are easy to distinguish: these reference images only resemble the target image at scene-level and have few common objects, such that a Ref-DIC model can trivially generate distinctive captions even without considering the reference images.

item.title: My View is the Best View: Procedure Learning from Egocentric Videos
item.description: Instead, we propose to use the signal provided by the temporal correspondences between key-steps across videos.

item.title: Efficient Modeling of Future Context for Image Captioning
item.description: Existing approaches to image captioning usually generate the sentence word-by-word from left to right, with the constraint of conditioned on local context including the given image and history generated words.

item.title: Deep Learning Hyperparameter Optimization for Breast Mass Detection in Mammograms
item.description: Accurate breast cancer diagnosis through mammography has the potential to save millions of lives around the world.

item.title: FairGRAPE: Fairness-aware GRAdient Pruning mEthod for Face Attribute Classification
item.description: Existing pruning techniques preserve deep neural networks' overall ability to make correct predictions but may also amplify hidden biases during the compression process.

item.title: An Ensemble Approach for Multiple Emotion Descriptors Estimation Using Multi-task Learning
item.description: This paper illustrates our submission method to the fourth Affective Behavior Analysis in-the-Wild (ABAW) Competition.

item.title: TinyViT: Fast Pretraining Distillation for Small Vision Transformers
item.description: It achieves a top-1 accuracy of 84. 8% on ImageNet-1k with only 21M parameters, being comparable to Swin-B pretrained on ImageNet-21k while using 4. 2 times fewer parameters.

item.title: Sobolev Training for Implicit Neural Representations with Approximated Image Derivatives
item.description: Recently, Implicit Neural Representations (INRs) parameterized by neural networks have emerged as a powerful and promising tool to represent different kinds of signals due to its continuous, differentiable properties, showing superiorities to classical discretized representations.

item.title: A comprehensive study of non-adaptive and residual-based adaptive sampling for physics-informed neural networks
item.description: Hence, we have considered a total of 10 different sampling methods, including six non-adaptive uniform sampling, uniform sampling with resampling, two proposed adaptive sampling, and an existing adaptive sampling.

item.title: Don't Forget Me: Accurate Background Recovery for Text Removal via Modeling Local-Global Context
item.description: To address this issue, we propose a Contextual-guided Text Removal Network, termed as CTRNet.

item.title: SplitMixer: Fat Trimmed From MLP-like Models
item.description: We show, both theoretically and experimentally, that SplitMixer performs on par with the state-of-the-art MLP-like models while having a significantly lower number of parameters and FLOPS.

item.title: KD-MVS: Knowledge Distillation Based Self-supervised Learning for MVS
item.description: Supervised multi-view stereo (MVS) methods have achieved remarkable progress in terms of reconstruction quality, but suffer from the challenge of collecting large-scale ground-truth depth.

item.title: Boosting 3D Object Detection via Object-Focused Image Fusion
item.description: Given a set of point features and image feature maps, DeMF adaptively aggregates image features by taking the projected 2D location of the 3D point as reference.

item.title: The Birth of Bias: A case study on the evolution of gender bias in an English language model
item.description: With full access to the data and to the model parameters as they change during every step while training, we can map in detail how the representation of gender develops, what patterns in the dataset drive this, and how the model's internal state relates to the bias in a downstream task (semantic textual similarity).

item.title: Focused Decoding Enables 3D Anatomical Detection by Transformers
item.description: Detection Transformers represent end-to-end object detection approaches based on a Transformer encoder-decoder architecture, exploiting the attention mechanism for global relation modeling.

item.title: Domain Generalization for Activity Recognition via Adaptive Feature Fusion
item.description: To this end, we propose \emph{Adaptive Feature Fusion for Activity Recognition~(AFFAR)}, a domain generalization approach that learns to fuse the domain-invariant and domain-specific representations to improve the model's generalization performance.

item.title: Generative Multiplane Images: Making a 2D GAN 3D-Aware
item.description: What is really needed to make an existing 2D GAN 3D-aware?

item.title: CodeT: Code Generation with Generated Tests
item.description: In this paper, we explore the use of pre-trained language models to automatically generate test cases, calling our method CodeT: Code generation with generated Tests.

item.title: Reinforcement learning for Energies of the future and carbon neutrality: a Challenge Design
item.description: Current rapid changes in climate increase the urgency to change energy production and consumption management, to reduce carbon and other green-house gas production.

item.title: Deep Learning of Radiative Atmospheric Transfer with an Autoencoder
item.description: This process ideally could create an autoencoder that would separate atmospheric effects and ground reflectance in hyperspectral imagery, a process called atmospheric compensation which is difficult and time-consuming requiring a combination of heuristic approximations, estimates of physical quantities, and physical modelling.

item.title: Efficient CNN Architecture Design Guided by Visualization
item.description: Our VGNetG-1. 0MP achieves 67. 7% top-1 accuracy with 0. 99M parameters and 69. 2% top-1 accuracy with 1. 14M parameters on ImageNet classification dataset.
